answers.answer: You never had a risk. A B6 deficiency? I truly doubt that you have, because B6 can be found in almost everything we eat. Unless you have starved yourself you would not have a B6 deficiency or you have taken antibiotic isoniazidSome Trade Names INHNYDRAZID, the antihypertensive hydralazine Some Trade Names APRESOLINE, and penicillamine Some Trade NamesCUPRIMINE (used to treat such disorders as rheumatoid arthritis and Wilson's disease)..B6 deficiency has nothing to do with HIV or AIDS.

This doctor I had was driving me crazy so many blood test and so on. He said I have Vitamin B6 deficiency, when I had all those symptoms, I starved myself for weeks, I started eating again in July when I got back m 3 months test results. Right now,i'm taking antibiotics and some other medicines for allergies, the antibiotics are for the tooth I had removed about 2 weeks ago. I don't know what to do anymore, I don't have cancer, I've never had an organ plansplant, no medicine or drugs, no diabetes, no leukemia, i'm not under chemotherapy. Now vitamin B6, this is driving me insane. I have an appointment tomorrow with a new Doctor I chosed from my insurance. For a piece of mind, I will ask for another HIV test, and a PCR test, but I don't know if the DNA or RNA. Do you know????
This has nothing to do with HIV. YOU don't need another HIV test. You're negative period. Move on.

question: My Doctor told me I lack Vitamin B6 which are the ones to produce antibodies. Now he wants to take another HIV test at 4 months from my exposure. I wanted to take a PCR Test, but I don't know which one is the one. Can you please help me, I have an appointment tomorrow and I will ask for the PCR test, is it the DNA or RNA to look for the HIV virus?
title: Teak Please Help me
